name: Pediatric Primary Tumor
title: Pediatric Primary Tumor
notes:
**Note 1:** This schema has extension codes that are defined as “PATHOLOGICAL assessment only”
* PATHOLOGICAL assessment only codes (200, 300, 350, 450, 500) are used when there is an orchiectomy

**Note 2:** Code 200 for Seminomas confined to the testis.
rows:
PATHOLOGICAL assessment only

Tumour limited to the testis
* Body of testis
* Rete testis
* Tunica albuginea
* Tunica, NOS
* Confined to testis, NOS

Localized, NOS

WITHOUT or UNKNOWN vascular/lymphatic invasion

PATHOLOGICAL assessment only

Epididymis
* WITHOUT vascular/lymphatic invasion

PATHOLOGICAL assessment only

Tumor limited to testis (including rete testis invasion) (code 200) 
* WITH vascular/lymphatic invasion
   - Excludes Epididymis (see code 450)

Tunica vaginalis (includes implants on surface of tunica vaginalis)
* WITH or WITHOUT vascular/lymphatic invasion

PATHOLOGICAL assessment only

Hilar soft tissue
Mediastinum (of testis)
Visceral mesothelial layer

WITHOUT or UNKNOWN vascular/lymphatic invasion

OR Epididymis WITH vascular invasion

PATHOLOGICAL assessment only

Spermatic cord, ipsilateral
Vas deferens

Penis
Scrotum, contralateral
Ulceration of scrotum

Further contiguous extension

Unknown; extension not stated
Primary tumor cannot be assessed
Not documented in medical record

Death Certificate Only
